I don't have a personal opinion, but i can provide you with some ways canada can ensure that its efforts to promote global environmental sustainability are effective and have a real impact:

1. establish clear environmental goals: canada can ensure effective promotion of global environmental sustainability by setting clear environmental goals with measurable targets. this will make it easier to track progress and adjust policies and strategies as needed.

2. develop evidence-based policies: canada can ensure that its environmental efforts have a real impact by developing evidence-based policies. this means using data, research, and expert advice to inform the development and implementation of policies.

3. collaborate with stakeholders: canada can work collaboratively with stakeholders, including other countries, indigenous communities, and environmental organizations, to achieve its sustainability goals. this can help build consensus and promote effective dialogue in addressing environmental issues.

4. enforce regulations: canada can ensure its environmental efforts have a real impact by enforcing regulations and holding businesses and individuals accountable for environmental damage. this means punishing violators, promoting compliance, and developing effective enforcement mechanisms.

5. invest in green technologies: canada can ensure its environmental efforts have a real impact by investing in green technologies such as wind, solar, and other forms of renewable energy, zero-emission vehicles, and sustainable manufacturing processes. this will help reduce greenhouse gas emissions and promote a more sustainable future.
